TrcCommonLib.trclib

Class TrcTestAnalogSensorValueChange<T>

  • java.lang.Object
    • TrcCommonLib.trclib.TrcDiagnostics.Test<T>
      • TrcCommonLib.trclib.TrcTestAnalogSensorValueChange<T>
  • Type Parameters:
    T - specifies the group enum type.
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    TrcTestDigitalSensorStateChange

    public class TrcTestAnalogSensorValueChange<T>
extends TrcDiagnostics.Test<T>
    This class implements a diagnostics test to monitor if an analog sensor value has changed. If a sensor value doesn't change, it could mean the sensor is malfunctioning or disconnected. This class extends the TrcDiagnostics.Test class. It provides the runTest method that reads the sensor value and compares to the previous sensor value to make sure the value has changed at least a specified minimum amount.

    • Constructor Detail

      • TrcTestAnalogSensorValueChange

        public TrcTestAnalogSensorValueChange(java.lang.String name,
                                      T group,
                                      TrcUtil.DataSupplier<java.lang.Boolean> conditional,
                                      boolean defStatus,
                                      TrcUtil.DataSupplier<java.lang.Double> sensor,
                                      double minValueChange,
                                      java.lang.String errorMsg,
                                      java.lang.Boolean stickyStatus)
        Constructor: Creates an instance of the object.
        Parameters:
        name - specifies the test name.
        group - specifies the test group.
        conditional - specifies the conditional method that determines whether the test will be run, null if none specified in which case, the test will always run.
        defStatus - specifies the default test status to be returned if the test is not run because conditional was false.
        sensor - specifies the analog sensor object.
        minValueChange - specifies the minimum value change to expect.
        errorMsg - specifies the error message to return if sensor value didn't change the specified amount.
        stickyStatus - specifies null if test status is not sticky (i.e. test status could be different every time runTest is called), otherwise stickyStatus specifies whether the test is true sticky or false sticky (i.e. true sticky: one success will make the test always return success).

      • TrcTestAnalogSensorValueChange

        public TrcTestAnalogSensorValueChange(java.lang.String name,

        Parameters:
        name - specifies the test name.
        group - specifies the test group.
        sensor - specifies the analog sensor object.
        minValueChange - specifies the minimum value change to expect.
        errorMsg - specifies the error message to return if sensor value didn't change the specified amount.
        stickyStatus - specifies null if test status is not sticky (i.e. test status could be different every time runTest is called), otherwise stickyStatus specifies whether the test is true sticky or false sticky (i.e. true sticky: one success will make the test always return success).

    • Method Detail

      • runTest

        public java.lang.String runTest()
        This method is called periodically to check the sensor value. It compares to the previous value for a change of at least the specified minimum amount. Note: If stickyStatus is specified, a one-time success or failure will make this test always that stick status.
        Returns:
        error message if the change amount is less than the expected amount, null otherwise.
